messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 57 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: Geometrically exact static isogeometric analysis of arbitrarily curved plane Bernoulli-Euler beam

Paper Abstract: 

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 57 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 57"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "Kirchhoff’s Theory of Rods",
        "Analytical solution for large deflections of a cantilever beam under nonconservative load based on homotopy analysis method",
        "On finite deformations of space-curved beams",
        "A finite strain beam formulation. The three-dimensional dynamic problem. Part I",
        "On finite element implementation of geometrically nonlinear Reissner’s beam theory: Three-dimensional curved beam elements",
        "Objectivity of strain measures in the geometrically exact three-dimensional beam theory and its finite-element implementation",
        "A consistent theory of finite stretches and finite rotations, in space-curved beams of arbitrary cross-section",
        "Geometrically Exact Finite Element Formulations for Slender Beams: Kirchhoff–Love Theory Versus Simo–Reissner Theory",
        "B-Spline interpolation of Kirchhoff-Love space rods",
        "An objective 3D large deformation finite element formulation for geometrically exact curved Kirchhoff rods",
        "A locking-free finite element formulation and reduced models for geometrically exact Kirchhoff rods",
        "Isogeometric analysis: CAD, finite elements, NURBS, exact geometry and mesh refinement",
        "Isogeometric analysis: Progress and challenges",
        "Isogeometric collocation for three-dimensional geometrically exact shear-deformable beams",
        "Locking-free isogeometric collocation formulation for three-dimensional geometrically exact shear-deformable beams with arbitrary initial curvature",
        "Isogeometric collocation methods for Cosserat rods and rod structures",
        "Isogeometric collocation for implicit dynamics of three-dimensional beams undergoing finite motions",
        "A total Lagrangian Timoshenko beam formulation for geometrically nonlinear isogeometric analysis of spatial beam structures",
        "A geometrically exact isogeometric beam for large displacements and contacts",
        "An isogeometric finite element formulation for geometrically exact Timoshenko beams with extensible directors",
        "Isogeometric rotation-free bending-stabilized cables: Statics, dynamics, bending strips and coupling with shells",
        "Consistent tangent operator for an exact Kirchhoff rod model",
        "Nonlinear isogeometric spatial Bernoulli beam",
        "Isogeometric Analysis of the Nonlinear Deformation of Planar Flexible Beams with Snap-back",
        "Geometrically nonlinear multi-patch isogeometric analysis of planar curved Euler–Bernoulli beams",
        "Isogeometric analysis for nonlinear planar Kirchhoff rods: Weighted residual formulation and collocation of the strong form",
        "On a geometrically exact curved/twisted beam theory under rigid cross-section assumption",
        "Rotation-free isogeometric analysis of an arbitrarily curved plane Bernoulli–Euler beam",
        "Mechanics of Structural Elements: Theory and Applications",
        "Isogeometric analysis of plane-curved beams",
        "Rotation-free isogeometric dynamic analysis of an arbitrarily curved plane Bernoulli-Euler beam",
        "Linear static isogeometric analysis of an arbitrarily curved spatial Bernoulli–Euler beam",
        "Finite rotation and finite strain isogeometric structural analysis (in Serbian)",
        "Invariant Hermitian finite elements for thin Kirchhoff rods. I: The linear plane case",
        "Invariant isogeometric formulations for three-dimensional Kirchhoff rods",
        "Isogeometric shell analysis with Kirchhoff–Love elements",
        "The NURBS Book",
        "The Theory of Shells and Plates",
        "Nonlinear static isogeometric analysis of arbitrarily curved Kirchhoff-Love shells",
        "Models and Finite Elements for Thin-Walled Structures",
        "Nonlinear Finite Element Methods",
        "A discussion of stress rates in finite deformation problems",
        "Finite Element Procedures",
        "Improved numerical integration for locking treatment in isogeometric structural elements, Part I: Beams",
        "A simple algorithm for obtaining nearly optimal quadrature rules for NURBS-based isogeometric analysis",
        "Dynamic multi-patch isogeometric analysis of planar Euler–Bernoulli beams",
        "An implicit G1 multi patch B-spline interpolation for Kirchhoff–Love space rod",
        "Isogeometric analysis applied to 2D Bernoulli-Euler beam model: Imposition of constraints by Lagrange and Penalty methods",
        "An isogeometric implicit G1 mixed finite element for Kirchhoff space rods",
        "On the analytical approach to the linear analysis of an arbitrarily curved spatial Bernoulli–Euler beam",
        "Consistent linearization for path following methods in nonlinear fe analysis",
        "Geometrical nonlinear analysis based on optimization technique",
        "Large deflexion, geometrically non-linear finite element analysis of circular arches",
        "Post-buckling behaviour of elastic circular arches.",
        "A study of incremental-iterative strategies for non-linear analyses",
        "Solution method for nonlinear problems with multiple critical points",
        "ABAQUS/Standard User’s Manual, Version 6.9"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 57 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in Geometrically exact static isogeometric analysis of arbitrarily curved plane Bernoulli-Euler beam, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
